image.altText: A man in an orange t-shirt with his hands behind his back and police officers either side of him.

props.synopsis: The man suspected of attempting to assassinate Donald Trump camped outside a golf course with food and a rifle for nearly 12 hours before he was spotted by the Secret Service, according to court documents.

title.children: Ryan Routh charged with gun crimes after Florida 'assassination attempt' on Donald Trump

image.altText: Troy Bell walks outside a court building holding a note pad.

props.synopsis: The defence lawyer for independent MP Troy Bell says the case against the politician is "misguided and misleading".

title.children: Fraud case against MP has 'more holes than a Balfours crumpet', defence lawyer says

image.altText: A sporting coach at a media conference.

props.synopsis: Despite regular rumblings about his job security, Port Adelaide's Ken Hinkley has an impressive coaching record — and it is easy to forget the challenge that confronted him when he arrived at the club a dozen seasons ago.

title.children: AFL coaching can be cruel, but Ken Hinkley helped the Power tear up its tarps

image.altText: A woman seated in a laboratory wearing a yellow jacket.

props.synopsis: Labor and the Greens are still hashing out whether to include a "climate trigger" that would see proposed resources projects barred if they emit too much atmospheric pollution in the Environmental Protection Authority legislation.

title.children: Nature law reforms unlikely to pass before Plibersek hosts global environmental talks next month

image.altText: Composite image of Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping

props.synopsis: The Russian and Chinese economies are lurching into ever more perilous territory, threatening the nations' alliance.

title.children: Why China's sinking economy could backfire on Vladimir Putin

image.altText: A man inspects damage to a green vine with grapes on it

props.synopsis: Producers in some of Australia's largest and most iconic wine regions say they have suffered crop losses due to frost, which is expected to continue in the coming week.

title.children: Grape growers in iconic wine region hit hard by unseasonal frost

image.altText: man in blue blazaer in front of australian flag

props.synopsis: In his early 30s, Tom Venning would become the youngest person to hold the federal seat of Grey if elected. He is the nephew of Ivan Venning, the former Liberal politician who held the state seat of Schubert for 17 years.

title.children: Tom Venning, nephew of former MP Ivan, announced as Liberal candidate for SA's largest federal seat

image.altText: Three ducks stand in snow

props.synopsis: Temperatures across south-east Australia have plummeted during the past 48 hours, leading to the coldest spring weather in decades.

title.children: Record spring cold snap delivers snow and severe frost to south-east Australia

image.altText: A sculpture of a face and head with red lips and the skill absent showing the outline of a brain

props.synopsis: Many of the risk factors for dementia – being female, growing older and the genetic lottery — cannot be avoided. But research is uncovering a growing list of ways to cut your risk.

title.children: The 14 risk factors to watch for as dementia cases set to skyrocket

image.altText: A young woman in a multicoloured jumper looks off camera

props.synopsis: Robert and Anne Geeves are found not guilty of murder, following a long trial held more than 20 years after Ms Haigh's disappearance in 2002.

title.children: Couple not guilty of murdering 19-year-old mum Amber Haigh

image.altText: Charlotte Wood, a 59-year-old woman with cropped grey hair, smiles, while standing in a well-lit doorway.

props.synopsis: Charlotte Wood is shortlisted for her 10th book, Stone Yard Devotional, a novel about a woman who leaves her life in the city to join an enclosed religious community.

title.children: Charlotte Wood becomes first Australian shortlisted for $100k Booker Prize in decade

image.altText: A split image with one AFLW Crows player being helped off the ground (left) and a Bulldogs player looking sad after a game.

props.synopsis: Adelaide premiership forward Eloise Jones and Western Bulldogs midfield star Ellie Blackburn will miss the rest of the AFLW season because of injuries.

title.children: Season over for star AFLW duo after in-game injuries

image.altText: Exposed timber beams inside a house which is under construction.

props.synopsis: It's not just Australian home owners who are being left to struggle as large numbers of builders go bust. Contractors, too, are facing hefty losses.

title.children: 'Historic highs' in builder insolvencies leaving families and small businesses in limbo

image.altText: A teenage boy in formal wear standing in an event hall with white chairs and cake

props.synopsis: Life saving and migration experts say the recent disappearance of a teenager who was swept from rocks has highlighted the urgent need for water safety warnings to be given to migrants even before they leave their countries of origin, in order to urgently reduce the high number of drowning tragedies involving new arrivals.

title.children: Teen's disappearance prompts call for migrants to receive water safety warnings before arriving in Australia

image.altText: A flag with the letter CFMEU on a building site with an urban backdrop

props.synopsis: An investigation by a prominent barrister has found the CFMEU's construction division was still under the influence of criminal elements, including bikie gangs.

title.children: Report finds CFMEU construction division made 'inadequate' attempts to root out bikies

image.altText: A composite image of a meteor hunter at a museum and performing a dance.

props.synopsis: For Robert Towers, hunting meteorites is a "wonderful hobby" — but his strike rate is impressive, and he hopes the ancient space rocks could hold undiscovered clues to the origins of the Earth and life itself.

title.children: Meteorite hunter with hundreds of finds under his belt still celebrating discoveries with a dance

image.altText: A house destroyed by fire.

props.synopsis: A house fire in Adelaide's north-east claims the life of a 74-year-old man, who was found unconscious inside the home but could not be revived, emergency services say.

title.children: 74yo man dies in house fire at Gilles Plains, after woman injured in separate blaze sparked by cigarettes

image.altText: A digital collage of a bald man sitting holding a glass of wine, with hand tattoos. Behind, holes are punched in a background.

props.synopsis: For three weeks, police recorded as a group allegedly orchestrated the murder of Alen Moradian – one of Australia's most feared organised crime figures.

title.children: The execution of feared underworld figure Alen Moradian raises uncomfortable questions for police

image.altText: an older man with a white moustache in transition glasses sitting on a step with his legs bent at the knee

props.synopsis: Ralph Ohlmeyer has made his mark in Waikerie's history in the form of two pennies. Historians say leaving something for the future strengthens the connection between people and place.

title.children: How two little pennies left in concrete strengthened one man's connection to his home town

image.altText: Picture of Jina Amini during protest

props.synopsis: While the world is focused on other parts of the Middle East, the Iranian people are fighting their own battles against a harsh government crackdown on women who unveil, and a ramp up in arrests and use of the death penalty.

title.children: As the world's attention focuses on a regional war, Iran's women are fighting a 'quiet revolution'

image.altText: A composite photo of Victorian opposition leader John Pesutto and former Liberal MP Moira Deeming.

props.synopsis: Former Liberal MP Moira Deeming's defamation case against Victorian Opposition Leader John Pesutto has begun in the Federal Court.

title.children: Victorian opposition leader 'tarred' MP with 'the Nazi brush', defamation case hears

image.altText: William Swale at court

props.synopsis: William Herbert Swale is facing a range of charges after the 2023 crash outside a Daylesford pub where five people died.

title.children: Court hears diabetic driver appeared 'vague' before crash that killed five

image.altText: An actress stands on stage in a black dress holding an Emmy statue at a microphone

props.synopsis: Australian actress Elizabeth Debicki has won an Emmy for her role as Princess Diana in The Crown. This and other highlights from the 76th Emmy awards.

title.children: Elizabeth Debicki wins Emmy for playing Princess Diana in The Crown

image.altText: An image of outside Manchester City's stadium, with a big banner saying "The best team in the land and all the world".

props.synopsis: The 'sports trial of the century' that the football world is waiting for — a private hearing to rule on Manchester City's 115 alleged financial breaches of Premier League rules — will begin today in England.

title.children: 'Sports trial of the century' to kick off into Manchester City's 115 alleged financial breaches

image.altText: A man sits with glasses on

props.synopsis: Tito Jackson, the third of nine Jackson children, including global superstars Michael and Janet, has died.

title.children: Tito Jackson, member of The Jackson 5, dies aged 70

image.altText: A group of women in Japanese traditional wear walk past two women in face masks in an ornate temple.

props.synopsis: Recent data shows a 32 per cent rise in outbound travel in the year to June, compared to the previous year, with Australians taking more than 11 million trips.

title.children: What is revenge travel? New data shows Aussies have made a habit of it

image.altText: 2 Little Green Island

props.synopsis: British-American movie producer and actor Douglas Gresham sells Little Green Island to a North Queensland family, putting it back in Australian hands.

title.children: Australian island that inspired the Narnia movies sells at auction for $5.6 million

image.altText: a pastoralist wearing a red collared shirt with his arms crossed in front of a level crossing

props.synopsis: A Northern Territory pastoralist has called for safety upgrades to an outback railway crossing where a cattle truck collided with The Ghan tourist train on Sunday, saying it's a "dangerous spot".

title.children: Pastoralist calls for upgrades at 'dangerous' rail crossing where cattle truck struck The Ghan

image.altText: Two women standing on their front porch

props.synopsis: The ACT's new assisted reproduction technology laws were introduced to protect the wellbeing of donor-conceived people, but IVF patients and doctors say they're having unintended consequences for women now trying to fall pregnant with donated sperm.

title.children: Anna and Alex are desperate for a baby. New IVF donor laws have made that 'near impossible'

image.altText: A woman in overalls in an art studio laughs.

props.synopsis: Jenna Pickering lives in one of the most naturally beautiful parts of the world, but it is the people — not the landscapes — that inspire her paintings.

title.children: Award-winning artist embraces 'every wrinkle' as she captures beauty of aging

image.altText: A Qantas plane on a runway, with a slab of the tarmac coming loose from behind.

props.synopsis: Teenage plane spotter Mitchell Booth recalls how he filmed the moment a Qantas aircraft damaged the main runway at Perth Airport at the weekend.

title.children: Teenage plane spotter captures moment aircraft rips up the runway during take-off

image.altText: A group of older high school students ar work in a classroom.

props.synopsis: A NSW Catholic high school will allow senior students to learn from home one day a week permanently following a trial that found the program helped students become more independent despite concerns about a lack of structure.

title.children: Private school adopts four-day week permanently after successful trial

image.altText: Aerial vision of a black car with both doors open and a battered front near the middle of an intersection.

props.synopsis: Members of the public have overpowered a man after he allegedly fired a shot, and tried to drag a woman from her car in Doncaster.

title.children: Man placed under citizen's arrest after allegedly firing gun following car crash in Melbourne's east

image.altText: A rescuer walks across floodwaters

props.synopsis: The death toll from flooding in central Europe has risen to eight people as thousands of people are evacuated from their homes.

title.children: Eight killed as flooding devastates Romania, Czech Republic and Poland
